column1: #Text=Manitouwadge is a township in Northern Ontario .
#Text=" Manidoowaazh " means " Cave of the Great Spirit " in Ojibwe .
#Text=While mining was at the forefront of Manitouwadge 's economic activity , forestry also plays a significant part in the town 's economy .
#Text=The town is also turning itself into a retirement community , offering some of the lowest housing prices in the country .
#Text=Manitouwadge ( Manidoowaazh in Ojibwe , meaning " Cave of the Great Spirit " ) was part of the range of the nomadic Ojibwe indigenous people .
#Text=The town was founded by Noranda ( now part of Xstrata ) in the early 1950s to support the company 's Geco copper mine .
#Text=Other mine in Manitouwadge is the Willroy mine , named after two of the " Weekend Prospectors " , William Dawidowich and Roy Barker .

column1: #Text=In the early 1980s , gold was discovered at Hemlo , near the intersection of highways 614 and 17 , about 50 km ( 31 mi ) south of the town .
#Text=Noranda acquired the mining rights to a significant portion of the ground in that area , and built the Golden Giant Mine .
#Text=It offered housing in Manitouwadge to many of the employees of the new mine , and the town boomed .
#Text=When the Geco mine closed in 1995 , Manitouwadge 's population decreased significantly .
#Text=After peaking at nearly 4000 people in the early 1990s , it decreased to less than 3000 by 2001 .
#Text=With the closing of the Golden Giant Mine in 2006 , the population dropped to 2,100 by 2011 .
#Text=Manitouwadge is at the north end of Highway 614 , 331 km ( 206 mi ) east of Thunder Bay and 378 km ( 235 mi ) north-west of Sault Ste. Marie .
#Text=From Highway 17 ( east of Marathon , west of White River ) , take Highway 614 north .
#Text=Eco-tourism is promoted here ; there are at least four small waterfalls in the immediate area .
#Text=Hunting , fishing and golf are the main summer attractions open to vacationers and residents .
#Text=There is a fully equipped gym , a large outside track , and a family pool .
#Text=Trails for hiking in the summer and trails for snowmobilers in the winter are also abundant .
#Text=There are ten runs for downhill skiing and two locations with cross-country ski trails managed by the Northern Trails Ski Club .
#Text=From the top of the ski hill , you can see the whole town .
#Text=Whether or not you want to is up to you .
#Text=High Falls of the Pic River , Lemay Road .
#Text=Hike may be steep for those with mobilty difficulties .

#Text=From Manitouwadge , drive about 60 km on the Industrial Road , a crushed gravel road , then leave the main road and get on a rough two-track and go a further 5.4 km to the falls - a 4WD is required for this part .
#Text=Take the first left , and then keep to the left .
#Text=There is a sign at the first branch directing you towards High Falls .
#Text=Friends Bakery & Coffee Shop , 200 Manitou Rd W , ☏ +1807 826-1376 .
#Text=Free continental breakfast , a fitness room and Wi-Fi .
#Text=Rooms feature a microwave , a coffee maker , iron and mini fridge .
#Text=Turner 's Northwoods Adventures , 371 Manitou Road , ☏ +1807 826-1224 , toll-free : +1 866-417-8687 , ✉ turnersnorthwoods@gmail.com .
